engine.overlay
Class OverlayPanel

java.lang.Object
  engine.overlay.OverlayManager
      engine.overlay.OverlayPanel

public class OverlayPanel
extends OverlayManager

The OverlayPanel provides a convenient way for users to evenly place up to 5 overlays across the top or bottom of the screen. OverlayPanel panel = new Overlay(someWorld, true); panel.add(overlay1); panel.add(overlay2); panel.add(overlay3); panel.initialize();

Author:
Se-Gil Feldsott & Andrew Brown

Constructor Summary
OverlayPanel(greenfoot.World thisWorld, boolean topOrBottom)
          Constructs the initial panel with a given world, and establishing its position on the top or bottom.
 
Method Summary
 void addOverlay(Overlay overlay)
          Adds an overlay to the panel.
 void initialize()
          This calculates important values in the OverlayPanel regarding spacing of the Overlays and it also places the OverlayPanel into the world.

addOverlay, getOverlays, getWorld, removeOverlays, setOverlayPosition, translateOverlays
